name: Cloud CLI
description: Learn to interact with cloud platforms through the command line. The CLI is essential for automation and scripting.

learning_steps.description: Choose and install the CLI for your preferred cloud platform:

options.title: Install the AWS CLI
options.description: Follow the official guide to install the AWS CLI on your system.

options.title: Install the Azure CLI
options.description: Follow the official guide to install the Azure CLI on your system.

options.title: Install the Google Cloud CLI
options.description: Follow the official guide to install the gcloud CLI on your system.

learning_steps.description: Run a simple command to verify your CLI is working correctly:
learning_steps.code:
# AWS
aws --version

# Azure
az --version

# GCP
gcloud --version

learning_steps.description: Set up your credentials to authenticate with your cloud provider:
learning_steps.code:
# AWS
aws configure

# Azure
az login

# GCP
gcloud auth login

questions.prompt: Why would you use the cloud CLI instead of the web console, and when does CLI become essential?
scenario_seeds: Your manager asks you to create 50 identical S3 buckets across 10 different regions for a new product launch
The DevOps team needs to add the same IAM policy to 200 existing rolesâ€”clicking through the console would take days
You need to document exactly how to recreate your cloud environment so a colleague can set it up identically
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain automation/scripting benefits AND describe repeatability for consistent environments AND identify scenarios where CLI is essential (batch operations, CI/CD pipelines).

questions.prompt: Walk me through how authentication works with cloud CLIs and the different methods available.
scenario_seeds: You're setting up a new laptop and need to configure AWS CLI to access your company's cloud account securely
Your CI/CD pipeline needs to deploy resources but you can't store your personal credentials in the build server
A security audit asks how your team manages CLI credentials and whether they're using best practices
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain the authentication flow (login/configure) AND describe credential types (access keys, tokens, service principals) AND address security considerations for credential storage.

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you ask me why cloud engineers use CLI instead of the web console?
